content.description: Start matched on crimp sidepull underneath the face. Move up over an arete.
content.location:
GPS coordinates are: 39.96352, -105.28769.

From the spire, go west through the slot.

content.description: Start with double underclings, and move left and up to the thread the needle finish.
content.location: Look for a deep crevice between boulders at the beginning of where Fern Canyon begins to get tighter and smaller. Make your way inside the crevice. This problem starts on the far right side of the crevice.

content.description:
Start on the far left side of the boulder, and traverse right staying low until you reach a questionable jug. From here, make a hard move up and right on the face, and continue right to the arete. This links

Fire Prancer

and Fire Dancer.
content.location: It is at the base of Fern Canyon on the Fire Dancer Boulder.

content.description: Start on obvious left and right-facing holds and your feet inside the slot below the start.
content.location:
It is directly left of

Slap the Cabbage

.

content.description:
Start matched in the hueco at the bottom left of the rock. Make moves upwards using both sides of the spire, and continue into

Bliss

.
content.protection: A minimum of 3 pads due to the uneven landing. A cliff spotter is suggested.
content.location:
Continue walking upwards behind The Slab until about 100 meters past the last sport climb. The Spire should be quiet obvious from this approach as it sits about 15 meters west of The Slab.

GPS coordinates are: 39.96345, -105.28737.

content.description:
Start on a sloper rail right of the base of the spire, and move onto the spire and continue into

Bliss

.
content.protection: A minimum of 3 pads due to the uneven landing. A cliff spotter is suggested.
content.location:
Continue walking upwards behind The Slab until about 100 meters past the last sport climb. The Spire should be quiet obvious from this approach as it sits about 15 meters west of The Slab.

GPS coordinates are: 39.96345, -105.28737.

content.description: Want something slightly harder? Then try this version!
content.location:
Start with

Slip

, and move past the ending of

Slip Slip

. Make your way left using edges. Exit straight up (see the beta photo).

content.description: The names of these problems all link together just like all these problems link together. Additionally, this is yet another awesome roof problem!
content.location:
Start as you would for “

Slip

”. Continue through a crux section to gain large finishing holds (see the beta photo).

content.description:
This is the longest and best version. This roof keeps going! Jugs, crimps, heel hooks, you name it, and it’s got it all. Start with “

Slip

”. When you get to the end of the rail for

Slip, Slip Slipity

, your right hand goes down below the rail and your left hand gains a series of crimps. Aim for the obvious ramp for your right hand. Move straight up to finish.
content.location:
Start with

Slip

, and keep going to the end. See the beta photo.

content.description: How many steeps roof boulder problems do we have in the Flatirons? Not a lot. This one starts with a right hand on an incut hold and a left hand jug on the lip (see the beta photo). Slap a series of moves to gain a large left hand hold to begin the exit. Move up and right to a horn and up to finish.
content.location: Directly where the North Shannahan trail meets the gully of Fern Canyon, look left. This problem starts almost midway up this rock band.

content.description: Start with your hands on the arete - your left hand on a crimp next to a right hand sidepull. Move left into the cabbage. Then top out on the right side of the arete.
content.location: It is just west of the crevice.

content.description: Start on an obvious, large hold, and make your way up using the arete and then right to the slab.
content.location: It is on the right side of the Hee Bee Gee Bee Boulder.

content.description: Start low, matched on a big undercling rail. Bump up into another undercling rail, and then make a big move to the lip. Pull up over the lip using a good crimp, and then top out up and left.
content.protection: At least two pads and a spotter.
content.location: Just behind the Slab, up towards the summit (see photo), hike uphill a few minutes past the sport climbing.

content.description: On the far right side, start with both of your hands on a rail.
content.location: It is on top of a ledge where lots of people hang out while hiking up Fern Canyon.

content.description:
This is an incredibly difficult traverse of a long, overhanging feature. This is highly recommended for crush stars like you! Start with the holds of

Ambidextrous

, and finish on the final holds of

Slip, Slip, Slipity Slide

.
content.location: It is at the bottom of Fern Canyon.

content.description: Start on the flake, move right to a pocket crimp, make your way left and up on bad holds that lead to a sharp left hand crimp, and slap for the top!
content.location: It is on the Sun Dancer Boulder at the base of Fern Canyon.

content.description: Start with your left hand on the arete while sitting down. Your right hand is in an undercling-like, pocket thingy.
content.location: It is on top of a ledge where lots of people hang out while hiking up Fern Canyon.

content.description: This is on a  sweet boulder! Start on the obvious, right side jug. Traverse across and up to a thoughtful finish.

Start on left side. Sit start inside the overhang. Make your way straight up the

He Be

topout.
Start on a good left hand sidepull and a suspicious right hand flake. Squeeze your way right and up.
content.location: It is on Fern Canyon Cave Boulder.

content.description: Start on a broken flake, and make a big move to the only crimp up and right. Then move to the arete.
content.location: Start right of Fire Dance.

content.description:
Start the same as far

A-void

on the prow feature, but this time move right.
content.location: Look for a deep crevice between boulders at the beginning of where Fern Canyon begins to get tighter and smaller. Make your way inside the crevice. This problem starts on the far left side prow and moves right towards the void.

content.description: Fernicious has steep and heel hooking fun. See the beta photo.
content.location: It is on Fern Canyon Cave Boulder.

content.description: Start low on the left side of the boulder, and work up to the point using the rail and some slopey jugs along the arete.
content.location: Just a little uphill from the huge boulders below the sport climbing on the slab, this problem is on the west face of the boulder.

content.description: Start on two crimps with your left hand higher than your right hand. Continue on big holds followed by just-good-enough crimps.
content.location:
It is below the ledge of

Left

and

Right Interference

.

content.description: Stand start on the left arete and a small, but good, right hand sidepull. Then bump up the arete, and use another sidepull until you smack the lip and get pitted.
content.location: Hike a little ways up behind the slab until you see this nice, flat face facing downhill (north). It's about 50 yards west of the slab.

content.description: A combination of squeeze and tech, this problem will test your will to grab the sharpest hold ever!
content.location: It is on the Fire Dance Boulder.

content.description: Start matched on horizontal rail in center of the face just above head height, and move upwards.
content.protection: A minimum of 3 pads due to the uneven landing. A cliff spotter is suggested.
content.location:
Continue walking upwards behind the The Slab until about 100 meters past the last sport climb. The spire should be quiet obvious from this approach as it sits about 15 meters west of The Slab.

GPS coordinates are: 39.96345, -105.28737.

content.description:
This

was

a boulder with one of the best V10s in the Front Range. In the flood, the earth from under it was washed away, and it tipped over.

This post serves to inform those who see it in the guidebook and hope to climb it that there is nothing to be climbed.
content.location: It was in Fern Canyon, next to the Superfresh Boulder.

content.description: Two different versions exist for this problem. Start and end in the same places, but choose going left or going up and right. Left is V6, and right is V8. Use the beta photo for assistance.
content.location: At the bottom of Fern Canyon, there is cave, a not so mysterious cave, where climbers go.

content.description: Start on a prow feature with either hand on either side. Make your way up then left.
content.location: Look for a deep crevice between boulders at the beginning of where Fern Canyon begins to get tighter and smaller. Make your way inside the crevice. This problem starts on the far left side prow.

content.description: Start in scoop, and go up and right.
